title: 106_hr5107
content: The Act may be cited as the "Work Made For Hire and Copyright Corrections Act of 2000". It pertains to work made for hire. The definition of "work made for hire" in section 101 of title 17, United States Code is amended to clarify eligibility criteria without indicating congressional approval or disapproval. The amendments made by this section regarding the definition of "work made for hire" in copyright law shall be effective as of November 29, 1999, and any invalid provisions or applications will not affect the rest of the section. The invalidation of any provisions or applications will not affect the rest of the section. SEC. 3. OTHER AMENDMENTS TO TITLE 17, UNITED STATES CODE. Amendments to Chapter 7 of title 17, United States Code include repealing Section 710, amending Section 705(a) to specify the duties of the Register of Copyrights, and amending Section 708(a) to outline fees for copyright registrations and renewals. The curr_chunk outlines various procedures related to copyright, such as renewal, registration, recordation of ownership transfer, compulsory license notice, author identity disclosure, additional registration certificate issuance, and other certifications. The Register of Copyrights is authorized to fix fees for services related to copyright procedures, including search, reporting, and preparing copies of Copyright Office records. Section 708(b) allows for the adjustment of fees for specified services. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act, with existing fees under section 708(a) of title 17, United States Code, remaining unchanged. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
